messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Cartoon History of the Universe
messages.msgSnippet: ... thread and I am really interested in this for my dd, Molly. What is it and where can I find it. It s called The Cartoon History of the Universe by Larry
messages.messageBody:
> Hi! In all of these emails I somehow lost the original email to this
thread and I am really interested in this for my dd, Molly. What is it and
where can I find it.

It's called The Cartoon History of the Universe by Larry Gonick (or Gonnick)
It's funny, irreverent, and easy to read. A kid might not get all the jokes
and stuff at first, but that wouldn't matter.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary
saftety deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...

Hi! In all of these emails I somehow lost the original email to this thread and I am really interested in this for my dd, Molly. What is it and where can I find it. Thanks so much! Kelli

wenrom31@... wrote:In a message dated 4/12/03 11:30:19 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> <<
> Are there more than two volumes of that yet? We have the first two, but
> they only go through Roman times (I think). >>
>
Actually, there is a third volume available now. It takes you through the
Renaissance.

Wendy in FL
